question: It betrayed Isildur to his death. And some things that should not have been forgotten...were lost. History became legend...legend became myth. And for two and a half thousand years the Ring passed out of all knowledge. Until, when chance came, it ensnared a new bearer!
answer: My Precious...

question: The Ring came to the creature Gollum, who took it deep into the tunnels of the Misty Mountains. And there, it consumed him. A RASPY VOICE mutters in the half light...
answer: It came to me. My own. My love... My preciousness.

question: You're late.
answer: A Wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.

question: It's wonderful to see you, Gandalf!
answer: You didn't think I'd miss your Uncle Bilbo's birthday?

question: What news of the outside world? Tell me everything!
answer: What, everything? Far too eager and curious for a Hobbit. Most unnatural... Well, what can I tell you? Life in the wide world goes on much as if it has past age. Full of its own comings and goings, scarcely even aware of the existence of Hobbits... ...for which I am very thankful. Ah, the long expected party. So, how is the old rascal? I hear it's going to be a Party of Special Magnificence.

question: You know Bilbo...he's got he whole place in an uproar.
answer: Oh, well...that should please him.

question: Half the Shire's been invited...
answer: Good gracious, me.

question: He's up to something.
answer: Oh, really?

question: Alright then..keep your secrets. Before you came along we Bagginses were very well thought of.
answer: Indeed?

question: Never had any adventures or did anything unexpected.
answer: If you're referring to the incident with the Dragon...I was barely involved...all I did was give your Uncle a little nudge out the door.

question: Whatever you did...you've been officially labelled as a Disturber of the Peace.
answer: Oh, really?

question: Gandalf... I'm glad you're back. Frodo leaps expertly from the cart. Gandalf smiles.
answer: So am I, dear boy...so am I

question: So am I, dear boy...so am I
answer: No, thank you! We don't want any more visitors, well wishers, or distant relations.

question: And what about very old friends?
answer: Gandalf?

question: Bilbo Baggins!
answer: My dear Gandalf!

question: It's good to see you. One hundred and eleven years old, who would believe it! You haven't aged a day! Gandalf and Bilbo laugh together and enter Bag End.
answer: Come on, come in! Welcome, welcome!! Tea? Or maybe something stronger... I've a few bottles of the Old Winyard left, 1296...a very good year, almost as old as I am. It was laid down by my father. What say we open one, eh? I was expecting you some time last week. Not that it matters, you come and go as you please, always have done, always will. You've caught me a bit unprepared, I'm afraid...we've only got cold chicken, bit of pickle, some cheese here...ooh, no, that might be a little risky... Er, we've got raspberry jam and apple tart...got some custard somewhere. Not much for Afters, I'm afraid. Oh no...we're alright...I've just found some sponge cake. Nice little snack. Hope it's enough. I could do you some eggs if you like?

question: Just tea, thank you.
answer: Oh..right. You don't mind if...?

question: No, not at all. Go ahead. A sudden loud knock on the front door.
answer: I'm not home. I've got to get away from these confounded relatives, hanging on the bell all day, never giving me a moment's peace. I want to see mountains again...mountains, Gandalf... and then find somewhere quiet where I can finish my book...Oh, Tea!

question: So, you mean to go through with your plan, then?
answer: Yes, yes...it's all inhand. All the arrangements are made.

question: Frodo suspects something.
answer: 'Course he does, he's a Baggins...not some block headed Bracegirdle from Hardbottle!

question: You will tell him, won't you?
answer: Yes, yes.

question: He's very fond of you.
answer: I know. He'd probably come with me if I asked him. I think, in his heart, Frodo's still in love with the Shire, the woods and the fields... little rivers. Bilbo stands gazing out of the kitchen window. I am old, Gandalf... Bilbo looks at Gandalf sadly... I know I don't look it, but I'm beginning to feel it in my heart. I feel thin...sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread. I need a holiday...a very long holiday and I don't expect I shall return...in fact, I mean not to. Old Toby, the finest weed in Southfarthing! Ohhhh, Gandalf my old friend...this will be a night to remember!

question: My dear Bagginses, and Boffins, tooks and Brandybucks...Grubbs, Chubbs, Hornblowers, Bolgers, Bracegirdles and Proudfoots... Today is my one hundred and eleventh birthday. Yes, and alas...Eleventy- one years is far too short a time to live among such excellent and admirable Hobbits! Tremendous outburst of approval! I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you as well as well as you deserve. I have..things to do and I have put this off for far too long... CLOSE ON I regret to announce, this is the end. I am going now. I bid you all a very fond farewell!! Bilbo looks across at Frodo, hesitates... then... Goodbye.
answer: I suppose you think that was terribly clever?

question: Come on, Gandalf! Did you see their faces?
answer: There are many magic rings in the world, Bilbo Baggins, and none of them should be used lightly.

question: It was just a bit of fun. Oh, you're probably right as usual.
answer: You will keep an eye on Frodo, won't you?

question: I'm leaving everything to him.
answer: What about this ring of yours? Is that staying too?

question: Yes, yes, it's in an envelope...over there on the mantelpiece. Gandalf frowns at the empty mantelpiece...Bilbo suddenly feels his waistcoat with a look of guilty surprise. No, wait. It's here in my pocket. Isn't that...isn't' that odd now? Yet, after all, why not? Why shouldn't I keep it?
answer: I think you should leave the Ring behind, Bilbo. Is that so hard?

question: Well, no...and yes. Now it comes to it, I don't feel like parting with it. It's mine. I found it. It came to me!
answer: There's no need to get angry.

question: Well, if I'm angry, it's your fault! It's mine. My own, my precious.
answer: Precious? It's been called that before, but not by you.

question: So? What business is it of yours what I do with my own things? Bilbo's voice, shape and manner have suddenly changed.
answer: I think you've had that ring quite long enough.

question: You want it for yourself!
answer: Bilbo Baggins do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! Bilbo cowers from Gandalf, disarmed by his power...a frightened Hobbit. Gandalf's expression softens. I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you. Sobbing, Bilbo runs to Gandalf and hugs him. All you long years we've been friends...trust me as you once did. Let it go!

question: You're right, Gandalf...the ring must go to Frodo. It's late, the road is long... yes, it is time.
answer: Bilbo?

question: Hmmm?
answer: The ring is still in your pocket.

question: Oh, yes. I've thought up and ending for my book..."And he lived happily ever after to the end of his days."
answer: I'm sure you will, my dear friend.

question: Goodbye, Gandalf.
answer: Goodbye Bilbo. Until our next meeting.

question: Riddles in the dark.
answer: Bilbo! Bilbo!

question: My precious...precious..
answer: He's gone, hasn't he? Frodo steps into the living room. He talked for so long about leaving...I didn't think he'd really do it.

question: ...my own.
answer: Gandalf?

question: Bilbo's ring. He's gone to stay with the Elves. He's left you Bag End... ...along with all his possessions. The ring is yours now. But it somewhere out of sight. Gandalf rises hurriedly and starts to gather his things.
answer: Where are you going?

question: I have some things I must see to.
answer: What things?

question: Questions. Questions that need answering.
answer: You've only just arrived! I don't understand...

question: What are you doing?
answer: Hold out your hand, Frodo...it is quite cool. What can you see? Can you see anything?

question: Nothing...there's nothing. Wait...
answer: ...these are markings. There are few who can...the language is that of Mordor, which I will not utter here. In the common tongue it says, "One ring to rule them all, One ring to find them, One ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them." This is the one ring forged by the dark lord, Sauron, in the fires of Mt Doom...taken by Isildur from the hand of Sauron himself.

question: Bilbo found it...in Gollom's cave.
answer: For sixty years the ring lay quiet in Bilbo's keeping, prolonging his life, delaying old age...but no longer, Frodo. Evil is stirring in Mordor. The ring has awoken. It has heard its master's call. AT THAT MOMENT

question: But he was destroyed...Sauron was destroyed.
answer: No, Frodo. The spirit of Sauron has endured. His life force is bound to the ring and the ring survived. Sauron has returned. His Orcs have multiplied...his fortress of Barad- dur is rebuilt in the land of Mordor. Sauron needs only this ring to cover all the lands in the second darkness. He is seeking it, seeking it, all his thought is bent on it. For the ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its master

question: Take it! Take it!
answer: No, Frodo...

question: You must take it.
answer: You cannot offer me this ring.

question: I'm giving it to you!
answer: Don't tempt me, Frodo. I dare not take it, not even to keep it safe. Understand, Frodo...I would use this Ring from a desire to do good...but through me, it would wield a power too great and terrible to imagine.

question: But it cannot stay in the Shire!
answer: No, no it can't.

question: What must I do?
answer: You must leave, and leave quickly. Get out of the Shire.

question: Where? Where shall I go?
answer: Make for the village of Bree.

question: Bree? What about you?
answer: I will, be waiting for you at the Inn of the Prancing Pony. Frodo packs his food into his knapsack.

question: And the ring will be safe there?
answer: I don't know, Frodo. I don't have any answers. I must see the Head of my Order. He is both wise and powerful. Trust me, Frodo. He'll know what to go.

question: My dear Frodo, Hobbits really are amazing creatures. You can learn all that there is to know about their ways in a month, and yet, after a hundred years, they can still surprise you. Get down! Confound it all! Samwise Gamgee, have you been eavesdropping?
answer: I ain't been dropping no eaves, sir! Honest. I was just cutting the grass under the window there, if you follow me...

question: It's a little late for trimming the hedges, don't you think?
answer: I heard raised voices...

question: What did you hear? Speak!
answer: Nothing important...that is, I heard a good deal about a ring...and a Dark Lord. And something about the end of the world, but...Please, Mr. Gandalf, sir, don't hurt me! Don't turn me into anything unnatural!

question: No? Perhaps not. I've thought of a better use for you. Come along, Samwise...keep up... Be careful, both of you. The Enemy has many spies in his service, many ways of hearing...birds, beasts... Is it safe? Never put it on, for then the agents of the Dark Lord will be drawn to its power...Always remember, Frodo, the ring is trying to get back to its master...it wants to be found. Gandalf wheels his horse and gallops away.
answer: This is it.

question: Smoke rises once more from the mountain of doom...the shadow takes shape in the darkness of Mordor; the hour grows late...and Gandalf the Grey rides to Isengard seeking my counsel... For that is why you have come, is it not, my old friend?
answer: Saruman!

question: Are you sure of this?
answer: Beyond any doubt.

question: So the ring of power has been found?
answer: All these long years it was in the Shire, under my very nose.

question: And yet you did not have the wit to see it! Your love of the Halfling's leaf has clearly slowed your mind.
answer: We still have time...time enough to counter Sauron...if we act quickly.

question: Time? What time do you think we have? Sauron has regained much of his former strength. He cannot yet take physical form...but his spirit has lost none of its potency. Concealed within his fortress, the lord of Mordor sees all. His gaze pierces cloud, shadow, earth, and flesh. You know of what I speak, Gandalf...a great Eye, lidless, wreathed in flame.
answer: The eye of Sauron.

question: He is gathering all evil to him. Very soon he will have summoned an army great enough to launch an assault upon Middle earth.
answer: You know this? How?

question: I have seen it.
answer: A palantir is a dangerous tool, Saruman.

question: Why? Why should we fear to use it?
answer: They are not all accounted for, the lost seeing-stones...we do not know who else may be watching. Gandalf throws the cloth back over the Palantir.

question: The hour is later than you think. Sauron's forces are already moving...the Nine have left Minas Morgul.
answer: The nine!

question: They crossed the river Isen in Midsummer's eve, disguised as riders in black.
answer: They have reached the Shire? Saruman shrugs...

question: They will find the ring...and kill the one who carries it. You did not seriously think a Hobbit could contend with the will of Sauron? There are none who can. Against the power of Mordor, there can be no victory. We must join with him, Gandalf. We must join with Sauron. It would be wise, my friend.
answer: Tell me, friend, when did Saruman the wise abandon reason for madness?

question: Mr. Frodo. Mr. Frodo! Frodo turns, surprised as Sam comes running towards him. I thought I lost you. Frodo looks at Sam suspiciously. Sam glances down, embarrassed.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: It's just something Gandalf said...
answer: What did he say?

question: He said..."Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee." And I don't mean to.
answer: Sam...we're still in the Shire...what could possibly happen?

question: Hello Frodo
answer: What's the meaning of this!

question: Sam, hold this...
answer: You've been into Farmer Maggot's crop!

question: I don't know why he's so upset, it's only a couple of carrots.
answer: And some cabbages...and those three bags of potatoes that we lifted last week. And then the mushrooms the week before.

question: Yes, Pippin, my point is, he's clearly over reacting.
answer: Run! That was close.

question: Come on. We're headed for the prancing pony. We wish to stay at the inn...our business is our own. To Frodo's relief, the Gatekeeper unlocks the gate. Excuse me.
answer: Good evening, little masters. If you're seeking accommodation, we've got some nice, cozy Hobbit sized rooms available, Mr...ah...

question: Underhill...my name's Underbill.
answer: Underhill? Hmmmm.

question: We're friends of Gandalf the Grey...can you tell him we've arrived? BUTTERBUR frowns...
answer: Gandalf...Gandalf...Oh... Oh yes! I remember...elderly chap...big grey beard...pointy hat? Frodo nods with relief...Butterbur shakes his head. Not seen him for six months. Frodo is shocked.

question: You draw far too much attention to yourself...Mr. Underhill
answer: What do you want?

question: A little more caution from you...that is no trinket you carry.
answer: I carry nothing.

question: Indeed? I can usually avoid being seen if I wish, but to disappear entirely... that is a rare gift.
answer: Who are you?

question: Are you frightened?
answer: Yes.

question: You have a stout heart, little Hobbit, but that alone won't save you...You can no longer wait for the Wizard, Frodo. They're coming.
answer: Where are they?

question: They were once men. Strider glances quickly at Frodo, then looks away... Great Kings of men. Then Sauron the deceiver gave to them Nine Rings of Power. Blinded by their greed they took them without question, one by one falling into darkness and now they are slaves to his will. They are the Nazgul, Ringwraiths, neither living or dead. At all times they feel the presence of the ring...drawn to the power of the one..they will never stop hunting you.
answer: Where are you taking us?

question: Back, you devils! No! Frodo! Mr. Frodo!! Help him, Strider!
answer: He's been stabbed by a Morgul blade. The Morgul Blade suddenly melts...vanishing into the air like smoke. Strider throws the hilt down in disgust...

question: Do something.
answer: This is beyond my skill to heal. He needs Elvish medicine. Strider lifts Frodo onto his shoulders. Hurry!

question: We are six days from Rivendell. Frodo groans.
answer: Hold on, Frodo.

question: Sam, do you know the Athelas plant? Sam looks blank.
answer: Athelas?

question: Kingsfoil.
answer: Kingsfoil. Aye. It's a weed.

question: There are five Wraiths behind you, where the other four are, I do not know.
answer: Dartho guin Berian...rych le ad tolthathon. Stay with the hobbits...I'11 send horses for you. Close on

question: Hon mabathon. Rochoh ellint im. I'll take him. I'm the faster rider. Strider clamps his hand over Arwen's.
answer: Andelu I ven. The road is too dangerous.

question: Where am I?
answer: You are in the House of Elrond, and it is ten o'clock in the morning on October the twenty-fourth, if you want to know.

question: Gandalf!
answer: Yes, I'm here and you're lucky to be here, too. A few more hours and you would have been beyond our aid. You have some strength in you, my dear Hobbit.

question: What happened, Gandalf? Why didn't you meet us?
answer: I'm sorry Frodo. I was delayed.

question: Nothing, Frodo...
answer: Frodo! Frodo! Bless you, you're awake!!

question: Sam has hardly left your side.
answer: We were worried about you--weren't we, Mr. Gandalf?

question: Bilbo!
answer: Hello, Frodo, my lad!

question: Bilbo! "There and back again This is wonderful.
answer: I meant to go back...wander the paths of Mirkwood, visit Laketown, see the Lonely Mountain again...but age, it seems, has finally caught up with me.

question: I miss the Shire...I spent all my childhood pretending I was off somewhere else...off with you, on one of your adventures... But my own adventure, turned out to be quite different...I'm not like you, Bilbo.
answer: My dear boy...

question: No, what have I forgotten? Pull back to reveal Frodo, hands in his pocket, watching Sam.
answer: Packed already?

question: No harm in being prepared. Frodo strolls to the edge of the Balcony.
answer: I thought you wanted to see the Elves, Sam?

question: I do...
answer: More than anything.

question: I did. It's just...we did what Gandalf wanted, didn't we? We got the Ring this far, to Rivendell...and I thought... seeing as how you're on the mend, we'd be off soon. Off home.
answer: You're right, Sam. Frodo looks at Sam... ...we did what we set out to do. Frodo opens his hand, the Ring sits in his Palm. The ring will be safe in Rivendell. I am ready to go home.

question: His strength returns.
answer: That wound will never fully heal. He will carry it the rest of his life.

question: And yet to have come so far still bearing the Ring...the hobbit has shown extraordinary resilience to its evil.
answer: It is a burden he should never have to had to bear. We can ask no more of Frodo.

question: Gandalf, the enemy is moving. Sauron's forces are massing in the east. His eye is fixed on Rivendell. And Saruman, you tell me, has betrayed us. Our list of allies grows thin.
answer: His treachery runs deeper than you know. By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orc with Goblin Men...he is breeding an army in the caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in Sunlight and cover great distance at speed. Saruman is coming for the Ring.

question: This evil cannot be concealed by the power of the Elves...We do not have the strength to fight both Mordor and Isengard...Gandalf...the ring cannot stay here. This peril belongs to all Middle earth. They must decide how to end it. Not just for themselves but for those who come after. Elrond approaches Gandalf. The time of the Elves is over. My people are leaving these shores. Who will you look to when we have gone? The dwarves? They hide in their mountains seeking riches. They care nothing for the troubles of others.
answer: It is in Men that we must place our hope.

question: Men? Men are weak. The race of Men is failing. The blood of Numenor is all but spent, its pride and dignity forgotten. It is because of men the Ring survives. I was there, Gandalf...I was there three thousand years ago when Isildur took the ring. I was there the day the strength of Men failed. Isildur...hurry...follow me! IMAGES I let Isildur into the heart of Mount Doom, where the ring was forged Cast it into the fire...destroy it! Isildur!! It should have ended that day, but evil was allowed to endure. Isildur kept the Ring...and the line of Kings was broken. There's no strength left in the world of Men. They're scattered, divided, leaderless.
answer: There is one who could unite them, one who could re claim the thrown of Gondor.

question: Why do you fear the past? You are Isildur's heir...not Isildur himself. You are not bound to his fate.
answer: The same blood flows in my veins...the same weakness...

question: Your time will come. You will face the same evil...and you will defeat it. A si i-duath u-orthor, Aragorn...u or le a u or nin. The shadow does not hold sway yet...not over you and not over me. Renech I lu I erui govannem? Do you remember when we first met?
answer: Nauthannim I ned ol reniannen. I thought I had strayed into a dream.

question: Gwenin in enniath...u-arnech in naeth I se celich. Long years have passed...you did not have the care you carry now. Renech I Beth I pennen? Do you remember what I told you? Arwen reaches for Strider's hand...
answer: You said you'd bind yourself to me, forsaking the immortal life of your people.

question: And to that I hold. I would rather share one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone. Strider looks down. In his hand lies the Evenstar. I choose a mortal live.
answer: You cannot give me this.

question: Mines are no place for a Pony, even one so brave as Bill.
answer: Bye, Bill.

question: Go on, Bill, go on..don't worry, Sam...he knows his way home. Aragorn slaps Bill on the rump...Bill goes trotting off. CLOSE ON
answer: Goodbye, Bill.

question: Are we lost?
answer: No. I don't think we are. Shhhh, Gandalf's thinking.

question: Merry!
answer: What?

question: It's Gollum.
answer: Gollum!

question: He's been following us for three days.
answer: He escaped the dungeons of Barad- dur?

question: Escaped...or was set loose. And now the Ring has drawn him here...he will never be rid of his need for it. He hates and loves the ring, as he hates and loves himself. Smeagol's life is a sad story. Gandalf catches Frodo's look of surprise. Yes...Smeagol he was once called...Before the ring came to him, before it drove him mad.
answer: It's a pity Bilbo didn't kill him when he had the chance.

question: Pity? It was pity that stayed Bilbo's hand. Many that live deserve death, and some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them, Frodo? Frodo frowns. Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgment...even the very wise cannot see all ends. My heart tells me that Gollum has some part to play yet, for good or ill, before this is over. The pity of Bilbo may rule the fate of many.
answer: I wish the ring had never come to me...I wish none of this had happened.

question: Over the bridge! Fly! You cannot pass!
answer: Gandalf!

question: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udun. Go back to the shadow! The BALROG slashes at Gandalf with its Sword of You shall not pass!! The Balrog places one foot onto the bridge. Aragorn and Boromir race forward, swords drawn.
answer: Gandalf!

question: Fly, you fools!
answer: No!

question: Will you look into the mirror? Frodo looks with apprehension at the silver basin.
answer: What will I see?

question: Even the wisest cannot tell for the mirror shows many things...things that were ..things that are...and some things that have not yet come to pass.
answer: Gandalf!

question: I know what it is you saw...for it is also in my mind. It is the future, Frodo. It is what will come to pass if you should fail. The fellowship is breaking. It has already begun. He will try to take the ring. You know of whom I speak. One by one, it will destroy them all.
answer: If you ask it of me, I will give you the One Ring.

question: You offer it to me freely...I do not deny that my heart has greatly desired this. In place of the Dark Lord, you would have a Queen, not dark, but beautiful and terrible as the Dawn. Treacherous as the Sea! Stronger than the foundations of the earth...all shall love me and despair! Frodo takes a step away from Galadriel... I pass the test. I will diminish and go into the west and remain Galadriel. Frodo's confidence drains away.
answer: I cannot do this alone...

question: You are the ring-bearer, Frodo...to bear a ring of power is to be alone. This task was appointed to you, and if you do not find a way, no one will.
answer: Then I know what I must do. It's just...I'm afraid to do it. Galadriel kneels down to Frodo's height, staring at him intently.

question: None of us should wander alone; you least of all. So much depends on you...Frodo? I know why you seek solitude. You suffer, I see it day by day. Are you sure you do not suffer needlessly? Let me help you. There are other ways, Frodo..other paths that we might take.
answer: I know what you would say, and it would seem like wisdom but for the warning of my heart.

question: Warning? Against what? We are all afraid, Frodo. But to let that fear drive us to destroy what hope we have...don't you see that is madness?
answer: There is no other way.

question: I ask only for the strength to defend my people. If you would but lend me the ring...
answer: No. . .

question: Why do you recoil? I am no thief.
answer: You are not yourself.

question: Frodo?
answer: It has taken Boromir. ARAGORN moves towards Frodo...

question: Where is the ring?
answer: Stay away!

question: Frodo...I swore to protect you.
answer: Can you protect me from yourself? Would you destroy it?

question: I would have gone with you to the end... into the very fires of Mordor.
answer: I know...Look after the others, especially Sam...he will not understand.

question: Frodo! Hide here, quick!
answer: Come on... What's he doing?

question: He's leaving.
answer: No!

question: Boromir!
answer: Run! Run! They took the little ones... Aragorn quickly tries to staunch the flow of Blood from Boromir's shoulder. Frodo...where is Frodo?

question: I let Frodo go.
answer: Then you did what I could not. I tried to take the ring from him.

question: The ring is beyond our reach now.
answer: Forgive me, I did not see..I have failed you all.

question: No, Boromir. You fought bravely. You have kept your honor. Aragorn tries to bind Boromir's wound.
answer: Leave it! It is over...the world of Men will fall and all will come to darkness and my city to ruin..Aragorn..

question: I do not know what strength is in my blood, but I swear to you... I will not let the White City fall, nor your people fail...
answer: Our people...our people... I would have followed you, my brother...my captain, my King. Aragorn lays Boromir down. He is dead.

question: Not alone, Frodo. Mr. Frodo! Frodo, in the boat, paddling steadfastly away from the
answer: No, Sam. Go back,Sam. I'm going to Mordor alone.

question: Of course you are...and I'm coming with you!
answer: You can't swim. Sam!

question: I made a promise, Mr. Frodo...a promise. "Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee." And I don't mean to...I don't mean to.
answer: Oh, Sam! Come on then..
